These underwear are machine washable, and they retain their shape and quality after multiple washes, which is a huge plus for busy parents.Moreover, the sizing options available were accurate, ensuring a snug fit without being too tight or loose. These trainer underwear have truly made a positive difference in our potty training experience. I highly recommend them to any parent embarking on this milestone with their child. They're reliable, comfortable, and a great aid in the potty training process.

The reinforced seams and elastic waistband provide a secure and comfortable fit, ensuring that these underwear maintain their shape and elasticity over time.Adorable Colors and Prints (5/5):Make dressing fun with Fruit of the Loom Toddler Girls' Underwear, available in a variety of vibrant colors and adorable prints. From cute animal motifs to classic polka dots and stripes, there's a style to suit every toddler's personality. With Fruit of the Loom, you can trust that you're providing your toddler with the best in comfort and style.Conclusion:In conclusion, Fruit of the Loom Toddler Girls' Tag-Free Cotton Underwear offers the perfect combination of comfort, durability, and style for your little one. Keep your little one comfortable and happy all day long with Fruit of the Loom Toddler Girls' Underwear.

ProductName: Fruit of the Loom Toddler Girls' Toddler Girls' Tag-free Cotton Underwear
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024
Comment: My almost 6yo daughter is a peanut at only 36 pounds, making it difficult to purchase the proper size clothing for her many times. She just started wearing a 4T these past few months, but many brands in that size are still too big.However, her 4T undies are now starting to get a little small. I wasn't sure exactly what size to get. The weight on the size 4/5T is 33-40 pounds, so since her 36 pound weight is right in the middle, it seemed to be the best choice, as opposed to jumping right up to size 5T, which seemed to be my only other option with other brands.I've bought Fruit of The Loom for her before and know and trust the quality. She potty trained late, and the undies held up through frequent washings and scrubbing out stains so I'm comfortable sticking with the brand, knowing their stability and elasticity will last. These Connecticut summers are very hot and humid, and the lightweight material is very important for her comfort.I'm glad I went with this size. They are a tad big in the bum, so she has room to grow, but they aren't so much that I can tell she has baggy undies when she wore them under cartwheel shorts. While they are Hipsters, as they are bit big now, they fit better pulled up a little, maybe a bit lower than where a brief would sit.The elastics are perfect around her waist and legs. As soon as I showed her the new variety, she immediately picked the floral print, and said how soft they were.Considering these inexpensive these are, they are very good quality. Although I suppose with kids it's not although they are wearing them for years, but the FOTL undies I have I bought for her almost 2 years ago and only now are they starting to get a bit worn out. Not bad at all for a underwear that cost $14 for a dozen pairs.Highly recommended!
